standard_metadata.standard_description: Compare two decimals to hundredths by reasoning about their size. Recognize that comparisons are valid only when the two decimals refer to the same whole. Record the results of comparisons with the symbols >, =, or <, and justify the conclusions, e.g., by using a visual model.
standard_metadata.standard_title: Order decimals and fractions in different forms

question.content: **Which of the following are greater than $0.4?$**

images.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 1 with tick marks every 1 tenth unit. Point A on the number line appears between the third and the fourth unlabeled tick marks to the right from tick mark labeled 0.

hints.content: Let's compare each answer choice to $0.4$ one at a time.

We can start with the number line.   Let's locate $0.4$ on the number line.    [[☃ image 1]]  $\blue{A}$ is to the left of $0.4$, so $\blue{A}$ is $\red{\text{less}}$ than $0.4$.   $\blue{A}\red{<}0.4$

images.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 1 with tick marks labeled every 1 tenth unit. Point A on the number line appears between 0.3 and 0.4 tick marks, closer to the highlighted 0.4 tick mark.

hints.content: $\purple{4 \text{ tens}}= \purple{40}$    $\purple{40} \green{>} 0.4$

images.alt: A big square divided into 10 equal sized rectangles stacked on top of each other. 5 bottom rectangles are shaded pink.
A big square divided into 10 equal sized rectangles stacked on top of each other. 4 bottom rectangles are shaded grey.

hints.content: The following choices are greater than $0.4:$  - $\purple{4 \text{ tens}}$  - $\pink{\dfrac5{10}}$

question.content: **Which of the following are greater than $1.27?$**

images.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 2 with tick marks every 1 tenth unit. Point A on the number line appears on the sixth unlabeled tick mark to the right from tick mark labeled 1.

hints.content: Let's compare each answer choice to $1.27$ one at a time.

On the number line, the length between each whole number is split into ten equal pieces.   Each of these pieces has a length of $\green{0.1}$.    $1.27$ is located between $1.2$ and $1.3$.    $\blue{A}$ is to the right of $1.27$, so $\blue{A}$ is $\green{\text{greater}}$ than $1.27$, so $\blue{A}\green{>}1.27$.

images.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 2 with tick marks every 1 tenth unit. A blue dot on the number line appears on the sixth unlabeled tick mark to the right from tick mark labeled 1. First bracket above the number line begins at 0 and ends at 1. Second bracket above the number line begins at 1 and ends at 2. Each bracket is labeled 10 equal pieces.

A number line labeled 0 to 2 with tick marks every 1 tenth unit. Point A on the number line appears on the sixth unlabeled tick mark to the right from tick mark labeled 1. Point labeled 1.27 appears between the second and the third unlabeled tick marks to the right of 1, closer to the third unlabeled tick mark.

hints.content: $\purple{1 \text{ one and } 7 \text{ hundredths}}= \purple{1.07}$  $\purple{1.07}:$|    - | - | - ${1.27}:$ |    $\purple{1.07} \red{<} 1.27$

images.alt: A big square is completely shaded purple.
A big square divided into 100 equal sized squares that are set in 10 rows of 10 squares each. In the bottom row, the left 7 squares are shaded purple.
A big square is completely shaded grey.

A big square divided into 100 equal sized squares that are set in 10 rows of 10 squares each. In the bottom 2 rows, all 10 squares are shaded grey. In the third row from the bottom, the left 7 squares are shaded grey.
A big square is completely shaded pink.
A big square is completely shaded pink.
A big square divided into 10 equal sized rectangles stacked on top of each other. 7 bottom rectangles are shaded pink.
A big square is completely shaded grey.

A big square divided into 100 equal sized squares that are set in 10 rows of 10 squares each. In the bottom 2 rows, all 10 squares are shaded grey. In the third row from the bottom, the left 7 squares are shaded grey.

hints.content: The following choices are greater than $1.27:$  [[☃ image 1]]  -  $\pink{27 \text{ tenths}}$

question.content: **Which of the following are equal to $1.3?$**

images.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 2 with tick marks every 1 tenth unit. Point A on the number line appears on the third unlabeled tick mark to the right from tick mark labeled 1.

hints.content: Let's compare each answer choice to $1.3$ one at a time.

On the number line, the length between each whole number is split into ten equal pieces. Each of these pieces has a length of $\green{0.1}$.  [[☃ image 1]]  $1.3$ is located $3$ tenths after $1$.  [[☃ image 2]]  $\blue{A}$ is located as the same place as $1.3$, so $\blue{A}$ $\green{=} 1.3$.

images.alt: A number line labeled 0 to 2 with tick marks every 1 tenth unit. The first tick mark to the right of 0 is marked green and labeled 0.1. A blue dot appears on the third unlabeled tick mark to the right from tick mark labeled 1. First bracket above the number line begins at 0 and ends at 1. Second bracket above the number line begins at 1 and ends at 2. Each bracket is labeled 10 equal pieces.
A number line labeled 0 to 2 with tick marks every 1 tenth unit. Point A on the number line appears on the third unlabeled tick mark to the right from tick mark labeled 1.
A big square is completely shaded purple.
A big square divided into 100 equal sized squares that are set in 10 rows of 10 squares each. In the bottom 3 rows, all 10 squares are shaded purple.
A big square is completely shaded grey.
A big square divided into 10 equal sized rectangles stacked on top of each other. 3 bottom rectangles are shaded grey.

A big square divided into 100 equal sized squares that are set in 10 rows of 10 squares each. In the bottom row, all 10 squares are shaded pink. In the second row from the bottom, the left 3 squares are shaded pink.
A big square is completely shaded grey.
A big square divided into 10 equal sized rectangles stacked on top of each other. 3 bottom rectangles are shaded grey.

hints.content: The following choices are equal to $1.3:$  [[☃ image 1]]  -  $\purple{1.30}$
